page.title: 05Ecology _ Waste Disposal.
page.content: Household waste and refuse is collected from a wide area od Sedgemoor district and is transported by road lorry to 303384. Here much of it is pulverised and spread over about 20 hectares of land some of which was the subject of a compulsory purchase order. Refuse attracts seagulls and thousands of these scavenge the rubbish tips. Large mesh nets cover the immediate areas of tipping to prevent seagulls scavenging and then dropping rubbish over the surrounding countryside _ a possible health hazard. A few hundred yards away from the pulveriser unit is the district sewage works at 303386. The partially_cleansed water is admitted to the River Parrett.
